TopicTitle: What is Reputation? The Forum Kind

Articles.Content: What does giving somebody reputation on their post do? Sorry if this is in the wrong spot, Idk where to put questions about the forum.

[quote name='Choctofliatrio']What does giving somebody reputation on their post do? Sorry if this is in the wrong spot, Idk where to put questions about the forum.[/QUOTE]
It should be in Kerbal Network, but what it does is adds points, and at certain point levels, you get green bars added.

[COLOR=silver][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

After five dark green bars, you get light green bars.

[COLOR=silver][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

This has some good info:
[URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95623-9-8-2015-Update%21-Say-Hello-to-the-Light-Green-Group%21[/URL]

Alright, thanks. Does giving reputation reduce your own?

[quote name='Choctofliatrio']Alright, thanks. Does giving reputation reduce your own?[/QUOTE]

No, there is no way you can lose rep (except if a moderator takes it away from you, but unless you cheated it, this is not going to happen).

Some time ago, negative rep existed in the forum; but after a dark story involving the Nemesis of one of our beloved moderators, it was removed...

Okay, thanks for telling me :)

Moved over to Kerbal Network.

You can read a bit more about the reputation system here: [url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51861[/url]

It's basically a nice way to say you like someone's post. There's no real benefit to having a lot, and no downside to giving it.

That's one of the best ways of summing up the entire rep system I've seen.
